comments.author: Coco
comments.content: Don't forget, low in calories and high in vitamin C, too. We buy the spicy one by the jarfuls here. I love mixing it with hummus, also!

comments.author: Kate
comments.content: That looks great. Eggplant is one of my favorite vegetables, so I always like finding new ways to eat it.

comments.author: Jay
comments.content: This sounds great, and I'm happy to have a way to cook with ajvar. (In Seattle, I buy mine at PFI, and typically use it as a vegetable dip.)

comments.author: Sabrina
comments.content:
Not only does this dish look easy and fun, but it is colorful and very appealing to look at.

I really like that you suggested the used of tomato sauce, as I don't care for avjar.... but who doesn't love tomato sauce on just about anything! Plus, I am much more likely to have that on hand.

I also really look that this looks classy and expensive, very good to impress people at dinner parties.

What are some more ideas for classy looking foods that won't break the bank? But still taste yummy?

comments.author: parsnips aplenty
comments.content: I discovered ajvar in Bulgaria and was surprised to return to the U.S. to find out that it's becoming the hot new condiment - lucky me!  I love it in a sandwich with sliced feta and scallions.

comments.author: G.R.
comments.content: Is there a store where I can get Ajvar locally?

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Hey G.R. - that depends, where are you located? If you are in Seattle, Big John's / PFI carries it.. and if you haven't been in there, you are in for a treat!
